alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Fauquier; Prince William; Rappahannock (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:57PM EDT until September 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL RAPPAHANNOCK...CENTRAL FAUQUIER...NORTH CENTRAL CULPEPER AND WEST CENTRAL PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES... At 457 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Warrenton, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Gainesville, New Baltimore, Opal, Turnbull, Meadowville, Airlie, Broken Hill, Auburn, Amissville, Casanova, and Orlean. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
